result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa M Gabert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Melissa M Gabert in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Melissa M Gabert in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates matter is close to resolving, requests another status in 30-45 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 8/03/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 11/17/15)
No contact direct or indirect with Walmart store in Sturgeon Bay.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Melissa M Gabert in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Status 9/24/15 at 9:45 am. Bond set.
